poem:
The Unseen Shift

Unheard whispers, ages bent,  
Time's quiet thief stole years—  
Unpaid debts in autumn's light,  
Leaves fall without remorse.  
Voices gather, a distant storm,  
Echoes of promise unfulfilled.  
Yet here, in silent dawn,  
Hope scribbles its protest  
In margins of a waking world.
